name: palette
content:

a thin board with curved edges and a hole for your thumb, used by artists to mix their paints on while they are painting: I was like an artist with his palette. He showed his student how to prepare a palette.
lightmax/iStock/Getty Images Plus/GettyImages
art
  specialized the range of colours that a painter, photographer, film maker, etc. usually uses: Matisse's palette typically consists of bright blues, greens and oranges. The director returns to the saturated colour palettes that made him famous.
the range of colours used in the decoration of a house, etc.: She chose a muted palette - putty green in the living room, a rich brown in the bedroom. I love this quilt, the colour palette is so soft and soothing.
computing
  specialized the range of colours available to the user of a computer, etc.: Pixels of two colours from the 16 colour palette could be displayed in each block.
a flat case containing make-up such as eyeshadow or highlighter of different colours: This palette contains nine of our bestselling eye colours. I decided I just couldn't live without those glamorous makeup palettes that I spotted in duty free.
